tit.e: Kaishaku (to assist someone in committing hara-kiri by beheading him)

sen.j: 介錯（かいしゃく）は切腹に際して、腹を切る時の痛みを軽減するために対象者の首を刀で刎ねること。
sen.e: Kaishaku (to assist someone in committing hara-kiri by beheading him) refers to cutting off the head of a person committing Seppuku (Japanese ritual suicide by disembowelment) by katana for the purpose of relieving the person of agony in disemboweling.

Kaishaku (to assist someone in committing hara-kiri by beheading him) refers to cutting off the head of a person committing Seppuku (Japanese ritual suicide by disembowelment) with a katana (sword) for the purpose of relieving the person's agony of disemboweling.

sen.j: 江戸時代中期以降になると切腹自体が簡略・儀礼化し、いわゆる「扇子腹」の形式で行われるようになり、切腹人が小刀・脇差に見立てた扇子に手を伸ばそうとした瞬間に介錯することがほとんどであった。
sen.e: Since the mid Edo period, in most cases, the Seppuku was simplified and ritualized, eventually reduced to a so-called Sensu-bara pattern, in which the assistant swung the sword down onto the person committing Seppuku the very moment the person reached for Sensu (a fan) which represented a short sword or Wakizashi used for disemboweling.

sen.j: 首を刀で斬り落とすのには首の骨の関節を切ること、身分地域により皮を残し切り落とすなどいくつかの作法が存在した。
sen.e: Several techniques were developed for beheading a person with a sword, such as striking the sword into the neck joint, and leaving a skin remaining between the body and the head, depending on the rank and province of the person committing Seppuku.

sen.j: 剣術の未熟な者は手許を誤って何度も斬り損ねたり、刀を損傷してしまうことも多々あった。
sen.e: Many cases are known that an unskilled swordsman missed his aim and blundered in beheading a person or broken the sword.

sen.j: これらは非常な恥とされたため、介錯人には特に剣の腕の立つ者が選ばれた。
sen.e: For the purpose of averting such a shocking disgrace, the assistant was chosen from master swordsmen.

sen.j: 三島由紀夫の自害の際に介錯人となった森田必勝は2度斬り損ねたうえに、刀を曲げてしまったといわれている。
sen.e: Masakatu MORITA, who assisted Yukio MISHIMA in the Seppuku suicide, failed in beheading MISHIMA twice, and besides, had the sword bent.

sen.j: 介錯には切腹に限らず世話をするという広い意味もある。
sen.e: The word Kaishaku broadly means assisting (or taking care of) without limitation to the occasion of Seppuku.

sen.j: 舞台芸能では世話をすることを介錯と称する。
sen.e: In the theatrical performance, Kaishaku refers to assisting (taking care of) someone.

sen.j: 例えば、文楽などの古典芸能では小道具の受け渡しを介錯と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In the classical entertainments such as Bunraku puppet theater, for example, Kaishaku refers to delivering hand properties.

sen.j: 現代の演劇では、幕の開閉や役者の動作の補助などを介錯と呼ぶ。
sen.e: In the modern theatrical performance, Kaishaku refers to such tasks of opening and closing the curtain and supporting performer's action.

sen.e: Even a tool named Kaishaku-bo (a stick to change the angle of light on stage or the like) is used.
